eadid.publicid: -//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NcD::William Heth papers, 1795-1799 //EN

titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Heth papers, 1795-1799
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Papers include circulars issued to collectors, instructions regarding sea letters and passports, regulations for arming merchant vessels, comments on recapture of American vessels from the French and strained relations with France, and a list of vessels registered and licensed in 1797.

altformavail.head: Alternate Form of Material
altformavail.p: Microfilm copy available. Contact Research Services, Rubenstein Library, Duke University Library, Durham, NC 27708.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: William Heth Papers, 1795-1799, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: William Heth was customs collector for Bermuda Hundred (Charles City County), Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Papers include circulars issued to collectors, instructions regarding sea letters and passports, regulations for arming merchant vessels, comments on recapture of American vessels from the French and strained relations with France, and a list of vessels registered and licensed in 1797.
